quote: Have you ever seen anything so   disgusting?
The way he's undressing her with   his eyes... and look at his   hands!
What about them?
Those gestures -- they're   obscene. You should arrest him.
You can't be serious...
He's pitiful. Doesn't he realize   she loves me?
Actually, I don't think he   does... and to be perfectly   frank, I don't think she does   either.
Oh, what do you know -- you don't   even recognize an obscene hand   gesture when you see one.
Maybe not. But I recognize   deluded fool when I see one..    (looking directly at    Quark)   ... and I'm seeing one now.
Thanks for the support.
Brother! I just talked to   Moogie. She says Grand Nagus Zek   has disappeared.
What do you mean, "disappeared?"
He left her a note saying he was   going on a business safari to   open new territories for   financial exploitation.
That's our Nagus.
He said held be back in five days   -- that was twelve days ago!
Twelve days?
Has he done this before?
Not for this long.       Moogie did some checking -- no   one's heard from him. He could   be hurt -- or even dead. We have   to do something!
He probably stopped off on Risa --   you know, for a little rest and   relaxation.
Risa? With all those gorgeous   women... he wouldn't do that to   Moogie!
Have you looked at our mother   lately? She's not getting any   younger.       Now do us both a favor and stop   worrying about Zek. He'll show   up.
Are you sure?
Good-bye, Rom.
Where'd Ezri go?
She slipped out the back. With   Doctor Bashir.
They left together?
I believe they were holding   hands.
Blessed Exchequer, whose greed is   eternal... whose wealth is as vast as   the cosmos...
Allow this humble bribe to open   your ears and hear this plea from   your most devout debtor.
Continue to bless my bar with a   steady stream of thirsty   customers whose pockets are lined   with latinum and whose skills at   dabo are shaky at best...
And while you're at it, see if   there's anything you can do about   Doctor Bashir... don't hurt him   or anything, just get him off the   station for a couple of months.   Oh, and one other thing...
I opened "negotiations" with Ezri   three months ago, but I can't   seem to close the deal. Anything   you can do --
Come in.
Ezri...
Anyone else here?
Just you and me.
(indicating the only    other door)   Is that the bedroom?
I owe you.
Does it have to be so rough the   first time?
I don't know what you think is   going on here... but think again.
Don't tell me this is some new   kind of therapy? Am I suppose to   start talking about my childhood   or something?
I hope not.
Good, because I'd rather talk   about us. Dax -- you're the most   fascinating woman I've ever met   I love you. There -- I said it!
My name's not Dax.
Oh, I get it. Your clothes...   the knife... this aggressive   attitude... it's all role-   playing.       Call me Shmun.
Shmun?
And I'll call you T'lana -- you   know, from "Vulcan Love Slave"   Volume Three.
You're a very confused man,   aren't you?
If your friend Zek is depending   on you, he's in bigger trouble   than he thinks.
Zek? What does he have to do   with any of this?
I'll let him explain.
Hello, Quark -- it's me. Your   Grand Nagus. You'll never guess   where I am.
Risa?
If you said Risa -- guess again.   I'm in the Alternate Universe!
You're not Ezri -- you're from   over there.

... well, you're going to have to   keep on wondering, because I don't   have time to tell you. You see,   I'm in a bit of trouble. I'm   being held prisoner by the   Alliance and I'm going to need   you to help me regain my freedom.   The Regent is willing to send me   home in exchange for a ship's   cloaking device.

They don't have them in this   universe. If only I'd known that   before I got here... I could've   saved myself a lot of aggravation   and made a nice profit at the   same time. Oh, well...       My fate is in your hands, Quark.   I need a cloaking device and I   need it now. You're the only one   I can count on. Do this for me   and I promise I'll be eternally   grateful. And don't forget to   tell your mother I love her. Good-bye.
He should've gone to Risa...
The Regent wants the cloaking   device in three days.
That's not much time. Cloaking   technology isn't easy to come by.
You'll find a way...
And if I don't?
The Nagus will die.
Anyone out there?
Not that I can see.
Then let's do it.
All right, together now -- lift!
It's heavy...
I noticed.
Watch the steps...
I see them, brother.
I told you cloaking the cloaking   device was a good idea.
Brilliant. But couldn't you have   done something about its weight?
(seriously    considering the    notion)   Uh... nope. But if it makes you   feel any better, the cloaking   device on the Defiant is a lot   heavier.
Tell that to my hernia.
You know what's bothering me...   it seems wrong to be stealing a   cloaking device for the Alliance.
We're not stealing it for them,   we're stealing it to save Zek.
But what about this other Ezri?   She's a Trill.
So?
So shouldn't she be with the   rebels fighting against the   Alliance?
Be sure to point that out when   you meet her. Just don't forget,   she carries a knife.
Shh. Someone's coming...
(re: the cloaking    device)   Quick -- put it down!
Act normal.
I'm telling you, captain --   we have to find a way to expand   our lines beyond the Kalandra   System.
I agree. If we don't move soon,   the ionic storms will isolate our   positions.
And allow the Dominion to flank   us.
Something wrong, gentlemen?
It's the bulkhead.
What about it?
Rom's thinking about painting his   quarters this color.
They already are that color.
I told you!
No wonder I like it.       It's a very soothing shade of   gray.
Glad you approve.
They're going into the Klingon   ship! What if they discover the   cloaking device is missing?
Let's get out of here!
Where is it?
I'm not sure.
Well, find it.
Oww!
Good job, brother. But I   wouldn't touch those induction   coils if I were you.
Thanks for the warning.
Up we go...
C'mon! Ezri's waiting in Cargo   Bay Fourteen.
Brother -- I just thought of   something...
Not now.
It's just...
Just what?
Isn't Cargo Bay Fourteen the   other way?
(re: the cloaking    device)   As soon as I give that to the   Regent, he'll release Zek.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Then what happens?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Then you get him back.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Would you stop doing that?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Doing what?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Staring at me.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Sorry. But you look just like   our Ezri, except you're a lot   taller.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: What are you talking about?   She's exactly the same height!
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: I don't think so...
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Don't be an idiot. I'm telling   you they're identical.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Do I have to throw you off that   transporter pad?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: One thing's for sure, their   personalities aren't identical.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: How do we know the Regent will   keep his word and send Zek back   to us?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: You don't. But there's not much   you can do about it, is there?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Yes, there is.       Brother, I think we should go   with her.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: I was afraid you were going to   say that...
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: I don't think you'd like it on   the other side...
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: That, I believe.       But my idiot brother is right --   we're coming with you.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Ferengis -- I'll have you hanging   by your ears.
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Well, what are we waiting for?
scene: 11   INT. DEEP SPACE NINE - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: It didn't work...
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Yes it did. We're on Terok Nor.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: It looks like Deep Space Nine to   me.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I suppose a cargo bay is a cargo   bay no matter what universe you're in.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: But this is an alternate   universe. Shouldn't everything   be different?
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: It's different enough. Remember   what Captain Sisko once told us --   in this universe, we're both   dead.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: That's so sad. I would've liked   to meet myself.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We better get moving. I've got a   ship waiting for us at Landing   Pad "C."
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: What's the rush?
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: This is a rebel base and we're   working for the Alliance.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Vic?
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I thought you two were dead...
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: We are!
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You're not a hologram...
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: A what?
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: Fontaine -- put down those   phasers!
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I'll see you in hell first.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I don't believe it... Julian just   shot Vic Fontaine.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: I thought Vic was his favorite   singer.       No wonder they call it the   Alternate Universe.
scene: 14   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN (OPTICAL)

quote: You, behind the crates -- come   out. Now!
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Do as he says.
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Well, well... look who we have   here.
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: I'll bet you're surprised to see   us... but I can explain --
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: You worthless piece of space trash.
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Leave her alone!
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: Hey, you're supposed to be the   good guys...
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: My mistake...
scene: 22   INT. TEROK NOR - CARGO BAY FOURTEEN

quote: (to Smiley and    Bashir)   -- but you don't understand, you   have to give us back the cloaking   device -- we need it to rescue   the Nagus.
That's not who you should be   worried about right now. You   know what we do to Alliance   sympathizers?
Give it a rest, Julian.
I'll give it a rest... as soon as   these three get what's coming to   them.
I don't know about you, but I   like our Bashir better.
(to Quark and Rom,    re: Bashir)   You have to forgive him.
He's had a rough go of it lately.   Lost a close friend in a skirmish   with some Alliance troops.
This isn't about Jadzia. Do you   know what would happen to us if   the Alliance got its hands on a   cloaking device?
It wouldn't be pretty.
They could wipe us out in a   matter of weeks!       Besides, there's nothing I loathe   more than traitors.
I'm not a traitor.
She's right.       You have to believe in something   before you can betray it. And   you don't believe in anything.
I believe in getting paid for my   work -- and you still owe me for   the last job I did for you.
We're fighting for our freedom   here... for our very lives. And   all you care about is money?
Like you said, you've got to   believe in something.
Let me ram those words down her   throat.
You're forgetting something,   Julian. The Alliance didn't get   the cloaking device, we did. And   that gives us the edge...       And we have these gentlemen to   thank for it.
What do you want to do -- give   them medals?
I don't think your Captain Sisko   would be too pleased to know that   you were over here interfering   with our affairs.
That's why we didn't tell him.
I suspected as much...    (to Bashir, re: the    Ferengis)   I say we send the Ferengis back   to their universe. Let Sisko   deal with them.
We can't go back. Not without   Zek.

The way I see it, you've got two   choices. You can either go back   where you belong or you can head   for Alliance territory and try to   rescue your friend without the   cloaking device.       You have 'til morning to decide.
Either way -- you're staying with   us.
Tough break.
I'll live.
You sure?
Don't worry about me. But   Smiley's right about one thing   if you're found in Alliance   territory without the cloaking   device, you're dead.
Are you suggesting we go back   home?
It's the smart move.
Do we look smart to you?
My dear, you have such nimble   fingers.
How many times have I heard   that...
I don't think I could survive   this incarceration without them.
I'm so glad I could be of help.
I only wish I could return the   favor. After all, you've been   suffering here a lot longer than   I have.
Oh, it hasn't been too bad. I   always find a way to amuse   myself. Besides, the worst is   almost over... as soon as your   people bring the Regent the   cloaking device, we'll both be   free.
If Quark and Rom don't screw   things up...
Have a seat, lover boy.
Fragile isn't he?       You said your people could   deliver the cloaking device. You   guaranteed it.
So I did. And so they shall.
(suddenly all    sweetness and    light)   Then we have nothing to worry   about.
That's quite a temper you have,   my dear.
It's one of my best features.   Now where were we?
You mind tugging at my ear hairs   again?
Your wish is my command...
We have to find a way out of   here.
And then?
Then we get our hands on the   cloaking device and finish what   we started.
All right. Let's say you manage   to save this Grand Nagus of   yours. Then what?
Then we go home. And never come   back here again.
That's it?
Isn't it enough?
Quark, don't play dumb with me.   You're risking your life for him   -- there has to be a reason.
He's the Nagus. The man my   mother loves.
Not to mention, the head of the   Ferengi Alliance.
In other words, he's rich.
They don't come any richer.
I see. How much do you expect to   get out of him?
Knowing the Nagus... I'd say a   pat on the head and a fistful of   empty promises.
I don't understand.
There's nothing to understand.   He's my Nagus. And when your   Nagus gets in trouble, you're   supposed to do something about it.
Why?
I don't know... loyalty?
You're kidding me, right? You're   doing this out of loyalty?
Would you stop looking at me like   that -- you're making me feel   like an idiot.
I hope so.
Brother! I just realized   something...
This should be good.
This is suppose to be an   alternate universe, but their   Captain O'Brien seems as nice as   our Chief O'Brien.
So?
Don't you see? It doesn't make   any sense! It's not "alternate"...
Go back to sleep, Rom.
Right.       But it's all very confusing...
What was that?
How would I know?
Brother -- look out! It's Brunt!
I don't think that's our Brunt.
What took you so long?
Sorry, but I've been a little   busy... I had to break into the   cargo bay, steal back the cloaking   device you lost and get it onto our   ship. And on top of that --
Quit complaining and get us out   of here.
I'm working on it.
You two must be hungry. I've got   food and drink waiting for you on   the ship.
He's so thoughtful.
Scary, isn't it?
What was that?
Brunt modified the dilithium   matrix to maximize the power   output.
He did, did he?
He's a very good engineer.
He's also a very good cook.   These fried tube grubs are   delicious.
Better hope he didn't poison   them.

Maybe in our universe he'd do   something like that -- but not   over here. Over here,   everything's "alternate" -- so   he's a nice guy.       Which means the tube grubs here   should be poisonous, because   they're not poisonous on our   side.
But if Brunt gave us poisonous   tube grubs it would mean he   wasn't as nice as we think he   is... but he has to be nice   because our Brunt isn't...
Rom, you're driving me crazy.
It's not me, brother -- it's this   alternate universe. It just   doesn't make any sense.
More tube grubs?
Yes, please.       No.       Yes?
In case you get hungry.       I put a cup of hot tea by your   bunk. You should get some rest.
It has been a long day...
You're telling me.
We're not due to rendezvous with   the Regent's ship for another   forty-six hours.
I'll wake you long before that.
I'd like to see the look on Bashir's   face when he discovers we've stolen   back the cloaking device.
You think he and Smiley will come   after us?
They can't let the Regent get his   hands on that technology.
Sounds like your sympathies are   with the rebels.
I hate the Alliance.
Then why help them get the   cloaking device?
Ezri and I are partners. More   than that... she's the closest   friend I've ever had.
And just how close is that?
Not as close as I'd like.
Too bad.
I'm not her type.       And I don't think you are either.
What makes you say that?
Let's just say that when it comes   to men, she's very particular.   Now if you don't mind, I need to   concentrate on remodulating the   ship's plasma flow.
Interesting...
My sinuses are clear for the   first time in years.
See if the Ferengi has any more of   this... beetle-snuff.
Certainly. But first, my Regent,   I must talk to you about the   Intendant. It took us over two   years to track down the   treacherous wench. We should   eliminate her and be done with   it.

I will deal with the Intendant in   my own way and in my own time.       But first, I want that cloaking   device. Think of it... with a   fleet of cloaked ships I'll be   able to crush the rebellion once   and for all.
And then we'll kill the   Intendant.
We'll see...
Big ship.
How do we know we can trust the   Regent? Once he has the cloaking   device, there's nothing to stop   him from killing us all.
It's a little late to back out   now, Quark.
By bringing him the cloaking   device, you've proven yourself   useful. Believe me, the Regent   never gets rid of anyone he finds   useful.
I hope you're right.
Me, too.
You. Come here. Your Regent   needs you.
Nice fit.
Our visitors from the other   universe are here... and I'm   happy to report they're not    empty-handed.
It can't be... look who the   Regent is!
(bigger problems on    his mind)   So?
So who's president of the   Federation? Morn?
There is no Federation here.
Is there a problem, Ferengi?
Just ignore him. Now if you'll   give us the Nagus... we'll be on   our way and you can go on with   your plans for mass destruction,   genocide and all those other   good things...
Victory is finally in my grasp.       I want it operational within the   hour.
And so it shall be, exalted one.
We have a deal, right?
Do we?
Tell him.
Yes, my dear, why don't you tell   him.
I knew you wouldn't disappoint   me.
Uh-oh.
You're not going to give us the   Nagus, are you?
You knew about this all along.
What can I say? I'm loyal to my   friends.
Isn't she the best?
(to Worf, re: the    Intendant)   I don't understand... you're   letting her go?
She's earned it. Getting them to   bring us the cloaking device was   her idea.
I think you've hurt his feelings.   He's probably never had a good   idea in his life.
I'm having one now... and I don't   think you'd find it very   pleasant.
Enough.    (to Garak, re: Quark    and Rom)   Get rid of these two.
Is that really necessary? They   may come in handy.
If the Regent wants your opinion,   he'll ask for it.
Don't kill them just yet...
But your magnificence --
You heard me, lock them up.
Let's go.
I hope you two are very happy   together.
We will be.
It's so good to see you.
Our Ezri would never betray us,   which means --
Don't start with that again.
You're not going to tell your   mother about the Intendant and   me, are you?
It would break her heart.

In a million pieces. She   worships me, you know. And I   worship her right back. Besides,   this is all your fault. If it   weren't for you, I never would've   been able to get to this   universe. Remember the last time   you came home to visit your   mother?
Well, one night while you were   sleeping, I got up to get a bite   to eat. And there, on the   kitchen table, was a Starfleet   PADD.
My engineering notebook?       With the schematics for the multi-   dimensional transporter that   Chief O'Brien gave me to study.       You stole it...
I'm your Nagus, you have no   secrets from me.
I still don't understand why   you'd want to come here in the   first place?
Simple, really. I came to find   new financial opportunities for   the Ferengi people.
In the Alternate Universe?
It seemed like a good idea at the   time...
If you say so.       Right now, it would be a good   idea for us to find a way out of   here...
I just don't feel right about   this. Quark and Rom deserve   better.
Forget about them, okay?
That's just it -- I can't. I   like them and so do you.
Don't tell me who I like.
Talk to the Intendant -- she   listens to you. Tell her the   Ferengi kept their part of the   bargain, we should do the same.
What a novel idea...
I can't recall the last time   I kept my word.
(refusing to be    intimidated)   Maybe now's a good time to start.
Forget it, Brunt.
No, not this time.
Let the man speak, my dear. He   obviously feels very passionate   about this... and you know how   responsive I am to passion.
Go on.
What do we gain by their deaths?   Nothing. On the other hand, if   we let them live, they may come   in handy.
I never thought of that...
The Regent will give them to you.   All you have to do is ask.
Maybe, but why waste a favor on   those little trolls? I'm afraid   I don't like your suggestion.
And now that I think about it, I   don't much care for you either
No!
He was going to betray me. I   could see it in his eyes.    (looking hard into    her eyes)   You wouldn't do that, would you?   Of course not.
I've suffered so much   disappointment in my life.   Brunt, Sisko, Bareil... the list   just goes on and on.    (looking down at    Brunt's body)   Dispose of that, will you? It   depresses me.
It's your mess. You clean it up.
She's not afraid of anything, is   she? Not even me.       I find that very exciting. Don't   you?
Regent, long-range sensors have   detected an enemy ship.       It's the Defiant.
Excellent.       It's time to test the cloaking   device.
I'm afraid it's not operational   yet.
And why is that?
It's a very complicated piece of   equipment.
One of the Ferengi seemed to know   how it worked.
Then why isn't he here?
I'll get him.
Getting the cloaking device    on-line? That's simple.
Good.       Lower the forcefield.
Hold on a second.       Why should we help the Regent --   or you for that matter?
I'm trying to save your lives.
That's a very worthy goal.
Since when do you care about what   happens to us?
All right, forget it.
I don't want to forget it.
I'm sorry, brother.
Maybe you want to die in this   crazy, mixed up universe, but I   don't.
Neither do I.       Lower the forcefield!
I suppose we have nothing to   lose...
Where do you think you're going?
With him. He needs my help.
You're a bartender, Quark. What   are you going to do? Mix him a   drink?
Don't worry, brother. I'm not   thirsty.
I don't expect you to believe   this, but I am trying to help   you.
You're right, I don't believe it.
Isodine coupler...
Does this look like an isodine   coupler to you? I don't see how   anything gets fixed around here.
I'd advise you to watch your tone   of voice, Ferengi.
Or what? You won't let me   install the cloaking device?
I'm sorry if I upset you. Now   would you please get back to work.
Don't mind if I do.
Really?
Absolutely.
I've never tried that before.
Few men have. I think you'll   find it very... stimulating.
And what do you expect in return?
Terok Nor, what else?
I plan to destroy that station.
Plans can be changed.
I'll consider it.
What more can I ask?
Uh, Mister Regent...
Your cloak is ready.
I can take it from here.
It's working.
Well done.
You mean no one can see us? How   deliciously deceitful.
Do you know how to operate the   device?
What I don't know, I'll learn.
It's pretty simple -- once you   understand the basics.       Now what about my brother and the   Nagus?
Do we have any further use for   them?
Not that I can think of.
Then get rid of them.
You mean we're going home?
No, he means you're going to die.
That settles it. I'm never   helping you again.
Or anyone else, for that matter.
I'm really beginning to hate this   universe.
What we have here, gentlemen, is   ten CC's of concentrated Ulcartic   virus.

It's very deadly. And quite   painful. It elevates your body   temperature, heating your   internal organs until they   literally boil. I was hoping to   use it on the Intendant, but I   suppose I'll have to settle for   the four of you...
So, who'd like to go first?
I'm waiting...
Why don't you give us a couple of   days to think it over and we'll   get back to you.
All right then, I'll pick. Let's   see...
What an amateur.
Excuse me?
I mean compared to our Garak.   That man knows how to conduct an   interrogation.
I'm not interrogating anyone --
Why not? Did it ever occur to   you that we may know things that   you could use to your advantage.
Like what?
We're not going to tell you --   not unless you interrogate us.
I don't have time for this. I   want to be on the bridge when we   destroy the Defiant.
In our universe, work comes   before pleasure.
Our Garak would have had us   hanging by our toenails by now,   telling him all our secrets.
What secrets?
That's for us to know and you to   find out.
If you were smart, you'd cross   over to our universe... get some   pointers from our Garak. When it   comes to torture, assassination,   sabotage -- you could learn a lot   from him.
I know all there is to know about   sabotage.
That's not what we hear.
Personally, I think you're   missing a great opportunity...
I admit I've often wondered what   my counterpart must be like...
I'll tell you one thing, he's a   very impressive person.
Go on. Tell me more.
Something's wrong. We should've   caught up with that Ferengi ship   long ago.
We'll find them.
For all we know, the Regent may   already have the cloaking device.       In fact, he could have us in his   sights right now and we wouldn't   even know it.
Don't start getting paranoid...   even if the Regent has the   cloaking device, chances are it   isn't operational yet.
I hope you're right...
They have no idea we're behind   them...
Nothing I enjoy more than a good   ambush.
It's time...
I don't understand... is this   Garak of yours an assassin or a   tailor?
Assassin.
Tailor.
Both.
Nevermind. I have to get back   to the bridge.
Now, who's first?
Drop the cloak.
I hate it when you're right...
Evasive action -- now!
Fire!
What was that?
Sabotage -- what else?
We've had a primary systems   failure...
That Ferengi -- he caused this!
I can't get anything back on-line.
You taught me something about   sabotage... now I'm going to   teach you something about pain.
Ow.
(through clenched    teeth)   That hurts...
How much is this going to cost   us?
I'm not doing this for money.
Then why?
You want to get out of here or   not?
Of course we do.
Then stop asking questions and   let's go.
They're not coming after us...
Why not?
They can't. Their power grid is   off-line...
Then what do you say we give the   Regent a proper greeting?
Reverse course.
We must raise shields.
We can't.
I don't know how much more of   this the hull can withstand.
Captain Smiley would like a word   with you...
That's a very nice ship you have   there, Regent. I'd hate to see   it destroyed.
But of course, if you insist...
What are your terms?
A simple unconditional surrender   should do the trick.
I'm afraid you've run out of   options.
The victory is yours.
Prepare to be boarded.
What a surprise. I've been   looking all over for you.
Here I am.
Is that really necessary?
I was about to ask you the same   question.
There, that's better. You and I   have to get to one of the escape   shuttles.
You go. I'm staying here.
You're not serious, are you?
You shouldn't have killed Brunt.
Isn't it a little late to develop   a conscience?
I hope not.
Brunt's dead?
(patting him on the    back)   Sorry, wrong Brunt.
We're not going to let her get   away, are we?
I owe her that much.
Oh, let her go.    (rubbing his ear    absentmindedly)   I can't quite put my finger on   it, but there's something about   that woman I find...   intoxicating.
Glad to be going home?
You bet I am. But that doesn't   mean I won't be coming back.
Here? What for?
There's a fortune to be made in   the Alternate Universe. I can   feel it in my lobes.
Well don't expect us to come   chasing after you again.
Don't worry, I won't. Next time,   I'm bringing you along with me.
In that case, I won't bother   saying good-bye.
You know, coming back isn't such   a bad idea... if I knew I was   going to see you again.
I'm not going anywhere.
In that case... maybe I should   stick around a couple of days.   You could show me the station...
I don't think that's such a good   idea...
I could help you work on that   conscience of yours.
I think I can take it from here.
Excuse me.
Leeta?
Do I know you?
We're married.
I don't think so.
You're Ezri, right?       Captain Smiley wants me to   debrief you.
Must be my lucky day.
Quite a fascinating place, don't   you agree?
I want to go home.
Me, too.
